body.name: SALAV Professional Standing Garment Steamer with Retractable Power Cord, Foot Pedal Control, Wheels for Easier Movement, Pants Press, Fabric Brush, Mini Ironing Board, 2 Hanger Clips, 1500 watts
features: POWERFUL - 1500 watts of powerful, continuous steam softens & straightens wrinkles on fabrics.
STORAGE - Rolling wheels, telescopic aluminum support bar, and retractable power cord stores easily
EASE - Safely smooth clothes, drapes, upholstery and hang any garment with the multifunctional hanger!
LONG LASTING - The removable 1.8 liter water tank provides over 60 minutes of continuous steam
DESIGN - Chrome Finish, Dual bar support frame, power & steam pedal control, & removable translucent 1.8 liter tank

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SALAV Professional Standing Garment Steamer with Retractable Power Cord Elevate your garment care with the SALAV Professional Garment Steamer with Foot Pedal Control and Retractable Power Cord. Boasting 1500 watts of steam power and a built-in ironing board, it's your ultimate wrinkle-removing companion. Get that crisp, polished look effortlessly.

What type of water should I use on my steamer? We highly recommend using distilled water to prolong the life of your steamer and to prevent mineral build-up caused by hard water (tap water). Is it necessary to drain the water and reservoir after each use? It's best practice to drain the excess water from the tank and reservoir to prolong the life of your steamer and to prevent mineral build-up. It also prevents water from spilling while in storage. I just got my steamer and the steam hose is really stiff. The hose is made with dual-insulated material to regulate temperature and once you start using your steamer, the hose will become softer. How do I troubleshoot leaking issues? Leaking usually happens when the water tank cap is not screwed properly to the water tank. This causes the tank to not sit on the steamer perfectly, causing water leak.

Previous page Ergonomic steam nozzle delivers powerful steam that softens & straightens even the toughest fabrics. Includes a multifunctional hanger with multiple uses. Steam press your pants to make straight trouser line. Helps remove pet hair, lint, and allows steam to better penetrate the fabric. Perfect took to help straighten collars, cuffs, and more. Next page 1 1500watts of Steam 2 Multi-function Hanger 3 Pants Press 4 Fabric Brush 5 Mini Ironing Paddle

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I. LOVE. THIS. STEAMER.
reviews.reviewText: Where have you been all my life SALAV Professional Standing Garment Steamer?? I am in love! I seriously don't know how I didn't have a full-sized steamer until now, nor how I survived without one. I absolutely despise ironing...avoid it at all cost. But then I walked into a clothing store a few months ago and saw one of the people working there steaming some clothing for a display. It just clicked...I needed a steamer!! I found this SALAV Professional Standing Garment Steamer, and I'm SO happy with it! I didn't want to spend a lot (these can be expensive), but of course, I wanted the quality of the top-of-the-line steamers. I don't think this is very far off! It seems to be good quality and really well made. It's really easy to put together, and even easier to use. You really need to use distilled water, which is only slightly inconvenient. However, if you use tap water, you do so at your own risk and you may need a new steamer in a few years. Especially with the heat it produces, the minerals in tap water are a killer for a machine like this. I found myself looking for things that needed to be steamed for the first week or so (I'm over that), just because it looks so nice when you're done! Get it. Get it now!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is AWESOME - gets VERY hot!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve only ever used small travel size steam irons so I don’t have much to compare this full size steamer to, but I know I LOVE it! I actually ordered this to steam extremely large canvases in my art studio, but since I started using this, I’v been steaming everything in my house from shirts and slacks to oversized table linens and drapery - I’m steam crazy! It doesn’t take long to set up, but I pored over the directions included, which were very clear and concise.I feel like the manufacturer of this product thought of everything. This steamer holds quite a bit of water, but it won’t work if you only pour a small amount into the “well,” but it holds quite a bit and I wasn’t constantly refilling it like I would with a small hand held one. Great lengthy retractable cord that you don’t have to wrap up after every use. This has a FOOT PEDAL that emits the steam which gets SUPER hot (obviously). I actually just ordered a steamer “mitt” separately from here on Amazon to protect my skin. The hand held head reminds me of my vacuum cleaner, the part that’s detachable, which is so convenient and easy to use. The rack from which to hang garments from is super helpful and has clips that keep your items in place. But most importantly, it works - and it works well. I can’t believe I waited this long to try a steamer like this. I’m thrilled about the amount of money we’ll be saving by steaming pieces ourselves instead of taking to the dry cleaners. Overall, just very impressed with this “tool” and highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easier than ironing
reviews.reviewText: Personally, I'd rather live in wrinkly clothes than spend my brief time on earth ironing them. Ordered this garment steamer hoping for a better solution.Set-up is straightforward, it's easier and slightly faster than ironing. I don't think it de-wrinkles as well as ironing, depending on fabric; the 100% cotton curtain took more effort/passes than the pants and I never could get it totally smooth which an iron could. Oddly, it wrinkled back up a bit later on (the "after" photo was taken immediately). Maybe I needed to pull it tauter? The viscose/poly pants took very little time. Preferable to ironing even with minor deficit in performance.Takeaway - Some quirks I'm slightly annoyed with (details below) but overall, happy to have this garment steamer and look forward to nicer-looking clothes. If you have the space and hate ironing, I recommend it. Has a 1-year warranty. If I notice issues as I use it more I will update review.More details - Tank is easy to fill and pour out, but water left standing in machine requires you to pull a plug and drain the rest. I had to find a shallow dish to place under the drain hole. There was still water visible in machine, it was awkward tilting the whole thing to coax it out. I can't tell the difference between "low" and "high" setting. It slows and sputters a bit if the hose is not kept straight enough, which isn't always easy to do when maneuvering up, down, and around a garment. I like the continuous steam but it would be nice if there were a temporary stop (like on some shower heads) to use while putting one garment aside and setting up another. The wheels don't roll well but I'm putting it in the laundry room and won't need to move it much. The cord is only about 6 ft. You may want to get a steam-proof mitt. Used distilled water to avoid funk and mineral build-up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything and More
reviews.reviewText: At first I thought I may be in over my head with this professional garment steamer, but I’m quickly catching on as it’s easy to use. And so fun, I’ve been steaming all of my clothes and linens. Comes with everything you need and is a breeze to set up.The only negative is that I’m having a hard time finding space for it to live. But I can definitely deal with that.
